channel.title: Android apps
channel.description:
FIRST POST IN THIS SECTION!!!!
:eek: :eek: :eek: :eek: :eek:
So post up your favorite android apps and most useful android apps.

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Does anyone have any preference over Swype or shapewriter keyboard? Shapewriter is no longer available but I can provide the .apk if anyone wants to try it.

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:18, topic:370042”]All the people downloading paid apps for free, seriously why? Most cost less than £1-2 and it supports the developers which in most cases is an individual. Android apps are being prevented from progressing because devs are leaving to go back to iPhone because of people like you.

It’s not like downloading music - where you can still go to the gigs to support the band.[/quote]Except it is the same thing because artists make jack shit from gigs.

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well the apps still seem to work. Mind you, we’ve recently replaced it (it broke) and installed a different one that asks you to kill them yourself (display information about memory usage, etc). It still seems to work, though I don’t pay much attention to it anymore.

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:32, topic:370042”]Yeah, but it doesn’t always work as well as it should. The HTC Desire i got (from an insurance claim) is running Android 2.2, 1Ghz processor, something like 574MB of RAM and it does get bogged down the longer it is being used.

Since I gave it to my sister to use, she also complained of it too, installed task killer (automatically kills background services every x amount of time) and it is better.[/quote]

i thought they removed the task killing syscalls in 2.2

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:9, topic:370042”]Handscent SMS
Open Home, best launcher I’ve found so far.
MP3 Music Online, download music straight to the phone for free.
Oh, and some good games are Doodle Jump & Angry Birds.
Also, if your android has a touch keyboard, I would advise getting SlideIT keyboard (slide your fingers across the keys, etc).
I take it you know how to get paid apps for free?[/quote]
4shared or applanet

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yeah, but it doesn’t always work as well as it should. The HTC Desire i got (from an insurance claim) is running Android 2.2, 1Ghz processor, something like 574MB of RAM and it does get bogged down the longer it is being used.

Since I gave it to my sister to use, she also complained of it too, installed task killer (automatically kills background services every x amount of time) and it is better.

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

Android keeps the apps on so that they can be turned on fast. If there’s a need for more ram etc android will close apps by itself… Read this

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Teh Spede:

David why task killer? Theres no need for it…

Kuz sometimes my phone lags, then i go in task killer and it says theres a ton of apps open so i close them all and it runs perfectly again, so it seems there is a need for it?

Is swype better than slideit?

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“thepinksock, post:23, topic:370042”]Yeah I agree with you guys about iphones apps being a lot better in general.

So I’ve got installed so far:
Advanced task killer
Air Control Lite (game)
Angry Birds (game)
AndChat
Handcent SMS
SlideIT (it appears swype isn’t free but this is)
google sky map (fuck my actual life this thing is amazing, urge everyone to try it)

Now how about widgets? I really liked the fact I can have a local area map as my background however it seemed to lag my phone out quite a bit so went back to the default htc moving background.

Specifically I’m interested in a widget that will control all the wireless/power options e.g.:
airplane mode/gps/sync/mobile internet/wi-fi/roaming

p.s. did i mention i love this thing[/quote]

power control widget allows you to do that, it comes built in on the stock rom and most other ones, here is how it looks:

second one is miui/cyanogenmod style

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Yeah I agree with you guys about iphones apps being a lot better in general.

So I’ve got installed so far:
Advanced task killer
Air Control Lite (game)
Angry Birds (game)
AndChat
Handcent SMS
SlideIT (it appears swype isn’t free but this is)
google sky map (fuck my actual life this thing is amazing, urge everyone to try it)

Now how about widgets? I really liked the fact I can have a local area map as my background however it seemed to lag my phone out quite a bit so went back to the default htc moving background.

Specifically I’m interested in a widget that will control all the wireless/power options e.g.:
airplane mode/gps/sync/mobile internet/wi-fi/roaming

p.s. did i mention i love this thing

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Well no, there are all sorts of statistics that back up what Greeny is saying. For developers, the iPhone is a more lucrative platform, and is much easier to make money on.

There is a reason the Android version of Angry birds is free and ad supported, because getting the Android user base to support paid apps in a similar fashion to the iPhone is very hard. Whereas the iPhone version is paid for with no ads.

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

All of my friends with iphone’s use this app(cydia or something like that) which downloads apps for free, so I don’t agree with the paid part.

Honestly Greeny, I doubt that they’re is a big difference is the amount of paid apps bought, most people go for free.

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I could point out so many apps that are still being developed on iPhone that are no longer developed on Android. Seems as though you’re happy to try and convince yourself otherwise in order to get something that’s already cheap and reasonable for free.

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

It is just as easy to get paid apps for free on the iPhone. If anything, I think developers are more likely to stay with Android because of the one time fee of $25 to get things listed on the marketplace, over the $99/year to use Apple’s iPhone SDK.

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

All the people downloading paid apps for free, seriously why? Most cost less than £1-2 and it supports the developers which in most cases is an individual. Android apps are being prevented from progressing because devs are leaving to go back to iPhone because of people like you.

It’s not like downloading music - where you can still go to the gigs to support the band.

Read full topic

item.title: Android apps
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“thepinksock, post:14, topic:370042”][quote author=maniown link=topic=466157.msg3411100#msg3411100 date=1290701032]
Hao 2 free app pl0x.
[/quote]
I did some researched someone on irc told me that you can download files, put them on your sd card then load them from your phone and install them that way.

What’s the best place to download pirated android apps then? They have a few on pirate bay[/quote]
There’s a setting that lets you download & install apps from Unknown sources, its in Applications iirc. Anyways, I usually open up www.4shared.com on my phone’s browser (as they actually have a search function) and then just search the name of the app and put apk at the end. Download the apk file, and run it.

Read full topic
